title: Claims Tiger Lily Hutchence is living in Western Australia with Pond frontman Nick Allbrook
text:
Tiger Lily Hutchence, the daughter of late rock star Michael Hutchence, is living in Western Australia, a new report claims.

The 23-year-old is said to be settled down in Perth with long-term boyfriend, Pond frontman Nick Allbrook, 31, The West alleged on Friday.

The pair are said to have been dating for two years, and are believed to be sharing a home in the Perth city of Freemantle.

Settled Down Under? The West claimed on Friday that Tiger Lily Hutchence is living in Western Australia with rocker boyfriend Pond frontman Nick Allbrook (pictured)

Close: The pair are said to have been dating for two years, and are believed to be sharing a home in the Perth city of Freemantle. Nick has shared video and photos of Tiger Lily, including this one, on his Instagram in recent months

Nick, a former bassist in hit band Tame Impala, is now the frontman of Australian psychedelic rock band Pond.

He has shared a handful of Instagram photos and a video of Tiger Lily, calling her his 'dream gal' in one such post.

Tiger Lily has a number of relatives in Australia, including her grandfather Kelland 'Kell' Hutchence, who is Michael Hutchence's father, and lives in Queensland.

Daily Mail Australia has reached out to Nick Allbrook for comment.

Loved up: Nick shared this photo of Tiger Lily, calling her his 'dream gal', on Instagram

Rock star: Nick, a former bassist in hit band Tame Impala, is now the frontman of Australian psychedelic rock band Pond

Tiger Lily graduated from university in July, with half-sisters, Fifi and Pixie Geldof, joining her during a ceremony at Goldsmiths, University of London.

Tiger Lily was adopted by Live Aid founder Bob Geldof after his ex-wife Paula Yates died of a heroin overdose in 2000 when the child was four years old.

A documentary about Tiger Lily's father called Mystify: Michael Hutchence had its world premiere in April.

Pictured: Another snap of Tiger Lily shared by Nick on his Instagram recently

Filmmaker Richard Lowenstein confirmed that Tiger Lily had a mixed response to some of the footage during an interview on Australia's Today show.

'Tiger Lily loved it but she did say, 'I don't think I ever want to see that again', because it was so emotionally tumultuous,' Lowenstein said.

During a recent interview with A Current Affair, Lowenstein spoke about what it was like to meet Tiger lily while working on the documentary.

Family: Tiger Lily (left) looked in high spirits as she graduated from university where she was joined by sisters Pixie, 28, (middle) and Fifi Geldof, 36 (right) in July

Private: Tiger Lily, whose full name is Heavenly Hiraani Tiger Lily Hutchence, has stayed out of the spotlight since the deaths of both her parents. Pictured with a friend

'I couldn't stop laughing. I'd be saying, 'You have no idea, I used to be with your dad and he'd say exactly the same thing as you just said', and she'd go, 'Tell me,' and I'd tell her stories and she was very moved by them,' he said.

Tiger Lily, whose full name is Heavenly Hiraani Tiger Lily Hutchence, has stayed out of the spotlight since the deaths of both her parents.

Michael died by suicide aged 37 in November 1997, and her mother Paula Yates overdosed on heroin in September 2000, aged 41.
description: Tiger Lily Hutchence, the daughter of late rock star Michael Hutchence, is living in Western Australia, a new report claims.
authors: Marta Jary For Daily Mail Australia
